noun.description: A flat surface on which a straight line joining any two points on it would wholly lie.
A level of existence, thought, or development.
examples: everything is connected on the spiritual plane

verb.description: (of a bird or an airborne object) soar without moving the wings; glide.
examples: a bird planed down toward the water below

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin platanus, from Greek platanos, from platus broad.
